main event: A circular object was observed in Arlington, Virginia, on 27 February 1961, exhibiting yellow-red brightness.
interesting points: The object hovered briefly before disappearing at a high speed toward the southwest,The object was described as having a circular shape and was the size of a pinhead,There was no sound reported during the sighting,The observation lasted approximately 15 seconds,The report indicated that the object could possibly be a balloon, aircraft, or an astronomical phenomenon.
witness description: Richard F. Rudd, Staff Sergeant, USMC, Communication Test NC, Reliability: Excellent
